snippets.heading: EOSEVM Open Sourced - 27 Apr 2023
snippets.content:
• The #EOS EVM source code has officially been open sourced!
  • This is an important milestone for the EVM, keeping with the #ENF's core values of open collaboration and transparency
  • EOS EVM GitHub: https://github.com/eosnetworkfoundation/eos-evm

snippets.heading: EOSEVM - 'no bugs'
snippets.content:
• 'We've audited so many EVMs in our time & this the first EVM we've ever audited where we've found no bugs' - Charles Holtzkampf of Sentnl.io
  • The #EOS EVM is so robust that even the number one bug bounty hunter on Ethereum couldn't find any vulnerabilities

snippets.heading: EOS_Fireside_Chat_Clips
snippets.content: • Clips from Fireside chat

snippets.heading: IBC & #EVM
snippets.content:
• The most notable impact of open sourcing the $EOS EVM is enabling all @AntelopeIO chains to also launch their own EVM as well.
  • With the recent release of IBC, this is important to ensuring cross chain compatibility & feature parity.
  • More on IBC: https://eosnetwork.com/ibc-using-eos/

snippets.heading: EOS_Contact
snippets.content: • I believe it would be the best to contact ENF in terms of these type of topics through their contact form that is available on their webpage: https://eosnetwork.com/contact/

snippets.heading: Hackathon Upland - Registration still open!
snippets.content:
• 'The contest ultimately ending at Upland's Genesis Week celebration in Las Vegas on June 9.
  • Registration deadline on May 12 and submission deadline on May 26.
  • After the finalists are selected for all three tracks, they will deliver a presentation to judges and players in Las Vegas on June 9.' - https://www.upland.me/events/hackathon-your-way-to-10k-and-2-million-upx

snippets.heading: EOSEVM miner.enf
snippets.content:
• The miner.enf is the CPU cost for mining the transaction as the RPC provider and the eosio.evm table balance is the gas revenue from the EVM transactions that is being set aside for a future burn.
  • The other accounts in the table are from end users who opened balances to hold dust due to the the differences in token precision between EVM and native.
  • https://eosnetwork.com/blog/eos-evm-tokenomics-deep-dive/

snippets.content:
• EOS Native - https://eosnameservice.io/
  • EOS EVM - https://github.com/eosnetworkfoundation/grant-framework/blob/main/applications/EVMNS.md

snippets.heading: Leap_4 Released - 25 Apr 2023
snippets.content:
• Today, ENF is excited announce the release of Antelope Leap v4.0.0 🦌
  • This enables features such as:
  • 🏎 Higher Performance w/Multi-Threading
  • 📊 Reduced Latency & Faster Block Propagation
  • 🔎 More Control & Visibility Around State & History Data-
  • https://eosnetwork.com/blog/antelope-leap-4-released

  • Response start: https://t.me/EOSNetworkFoundation/214011 - EVM contracts have the key essentially burned by default. Unless ...

snippets.content:

  • https://t.me/EOSNetworkFoundation/214033 : All incoming USDT (eos) to the bridge account are logged and ...

snippets.heading: EOS_Infation rate
snippets.content:
• The EOS token has a supply of around 1 billion.
  • When EOS started, the inflation was 5%, with 4% funneling into a savings account and 1% for Block producer rewards.
  • https://help.eossupport.io/en/articles/5698356-what-is-the-inflation-rate-on-eos
